review_text: It was an awesome experience being in Norton, VA for the July 4th weekend. Giant American flags hanging all over Main Street. The town had a parade with fireworks that were amazing. You could walk out the back door and sit and watch the fireworks very clearly. The house stayed cool while we were out during the day so it was great to come back and rest. We went to Wood Boogers grill which was awesome! Visited Flag Rock which was an amazing and beautiful overlook. Main Street is loaded with shops and beautiful to walk. Everyone in this are was so nice and welcoming. We met several neighbors and enjoyed talking with them. We got to see several coal operations which the kids thought were awesome. The house could have been cleaner, there were black hairs in the tub after the first shower I took, and I have blonde hair. When I went to make coffee the first morning we were there, a dirty used coffee filter and grounds were still in the pot. I also found used deodorant, toothpaste, toothbrush, and a brush with hair in it left in a drawer in the bathroom…. It definitely was not ours. They provided Olay soap in an unopened box, however shampoo and conditioner were in bulk bottles in the shower, so several people have used them prior to us. I did bring my own. There were condiments and food others had left behind in the cabinets and the coffee provided was in a huge foldgers plastic tub that who knows how many people have put there hands in. I just went and ordered online grocery pick up from Walmart about 10 min away versus using what was there. The couch is amazingly comfortable! Like where can I buy one just like it? It was awesome to sit on the front porch and just enjoy coffee or a drink after supper. The house is located on a pretty steep hill and there are several steps to get up to the house. One of the steps that have been redone is loose so you just have to be careful. The backyard is nice, easiest to access from the second floor where there is a walk out right into the back yard. The house has that old mountain town charm. Norton was like stepping back 20 years, even the prices on things, except gas lol. The fast food joints were even super nice! Being from the Richmond area it was so nice lol. I would 100% come back and stay in the house for the 4th of July weekend! Tons of outdoor stuff to do around the area. Only 30 min or so to Kentucky and Tennessee. Cheaper than any hotel and you have all the amenities of home.

review_text:
To anyone who is considering a Bed and Breakfast in the LYNCH, Kentucky area you would be hard pressed to find a finer place to stay than: TRANQUILITY IN THE MOUNTAINS. Not only would meet the finest hostess of a wonderful and Happy Home, well located between Green Mountain and Black Mountain. There are beautiful views and vistas from several vantage points near by. Lynch is a Historic town that was engineered and built by UNITED STATES STEEL CORP, in early 1900's. Almost all homes there were built by USS for the employees of the corporation from the Project Manager right down to the lowliest miner. The entire project was engineered and built and maintained by USS for the benefit of the Corporation and it's employees. Homes, Businesses, Company Stores, Churches, Library, Schools, Athletic Facilities/Fields, Hospital and Medical offices and the last to let you down; The Mortuary.
The area is called; "The Three City area," The Three Cities being Cumberland, Benham and Lynch.
The mining companies hired tradesmen from world-wide locations. There were English, African, German, Italian, Portuguese, Asian, Central and South America natives. Families, Married couples, Singles. The Company even Hired and Maintained their own Police Department, their own Fire Department. There was lots of activity in that small area and much of the work was unseen.
There are some sites worth seeing relative to the Coal Companies. There's a Museum, Portal 31 a Mine site and there are Guided excursions and tours available there.
If that's not your cup of Tea you can always sit on the Covered Patio at Tranquility in The Mountains and just enjoy the peaceful solitude while listening to the babbling creek and watching the abundant wildlife.

review_text: One of our best vacation rental stays we have experienced. Lynch, Cumberland, and Benham - the tri-town area near the rental, has about 2000 people in all. It was a very interesting exploration through the smallest of towns. Highly recommend visiting Portal 31 about a mile down the road, one of the largest mines in the US; and Nick, the director is very accommodating and friendly. I recommend calling them in advance and leaving a voicemail to arrange a "disney-like" tram-tour through the mine. The free breakfast every morning made by Nanci was an amazing touch you don't see anymore in the hospitality world. When you walk outside, you can just hear the creek, the breeze, the trees in the wind; it is just a beautiful tranquil getaway and well worth the visit. To get there you will be driving over a steep winding mountain from either side (from the west is an easier drive). The house has 4 separate bedrooms for privacy, just one TV (with many of the services - Directv, netflix, disney plus, hulu, etc), fireplace, fully stocked kitchen, 3.5 bathrooms (2 private, 1 jack and jill, and 1 guest without shower/bath). All in all, highly recommended stay and excellent value.

review_text:
We travelled here from Minnesota to visit family and study family geneology. This location was in the middle of our paths to Letcher County Kentucky and Wise County Virginia. It was a lovely time experiencing the spring season in this area, which is earlier than ours! The home was clean and dust free, if you have allergies. No carpets, only wood floors and a few rugs. The kitchen was well stocked and all the appliances worked well. The porch and fireside chairs outside were idyllic and restful, with an abundance of birds singing and a babbling brook running alongside the property! We were happy to have found this restful home, after our days of visiting relatives, searching cemeteries, and researching records in nearby towns. This is the area of past generations, and a rural home experience in the vicinity of family roots was perfect.
Communication was complete and easy, we had no issues. There is a small general store nearby that provided what little items we needed, take out sandwiches for picnicking, and a few gifts for grandchildren and friends. We appreciate some flexibility in scheduling, since we needed to add another day to our stay here. Since this was our first stay with an Airbnb, we will be happy to use this again.
